posts.content:
Hail, ECBers!

I know, I'm on a posting frenzy today. My wife is out of town for a week and I'm alone at home with nothing to do but play NWN and plan my classes. I have done all the work in the morning, so I thought I'd post all of my Henchmen remakes here. They have all been posted in the WoG forums, so it's not like I'm making them and posting them as I go. This was, I have to say, the most challenging build I had to make. It is Xanos Messarmos, the Half-Orc smartass Sorcerer from the SoU campaign. I know he was always dreaming of power, so I reckon that once he found out he had dragon blood in his veins, he'd want to take advantage of it. Making a functional Half-Orc Sorcerer alone would be quite an accomplishment, now imagine making a Half-Orc Barbarian / Sorcerer spellsword. I have NO BONUS FEATS for the first 30+ levels. And I have a penalty on my casting stat and few skill points. But, still I think I did allright whithin the limitations and wound up with a very interesting build. Unfortunately, it was either Tumble and UMD as class skills or high stats, and I chose high stats in the end. He's a fully-functional spellsword with decent AB and low AC, but he has a couple of tricks up his sleeve to deal with that, like Expertise, Damage Shields and DR spells (which he needs to use constantly) and Knockdown. He knows his defense is lacking, which is why he will prioritize buffs and defensive spells over offensive ones for the most part of his life. In the end, he gets Auto-still 3, EMA and EW and his suffering is over, unfortunately, they come WAAAY too late in the build. Still, he can be challenging to take on for the most advanced players. I'm tempted to try him myself if I have the time. Ohh, I almost forgot, he has Taunt to use against low concentration mobs. At lvl 40 he gets a big update, but for the most part, his Taunt skill will be rather low, so it will only be effective on mobs with no Concentration (but you can Taunt these, then fight in Expertise free of charge, gaining +1 AB and +5 AC)
